decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Metalworker and Grim Monolith, allowing you to bring out powerful artifacts like Blightsteel Colossus and Wurmcoil Engine. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Goblin Welder and Sundering Titan to control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy. With access to cards like Mindslaver and Batterskull, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with big threats and efficient plays. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Lodestone Golem also gives you ways to disrupt your opponent's mana base and slow down their game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Hellspark Elemental, while also packing a high number of direct damage burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The strategy is to apply pressure early and finish off the opponent with a flurry of burn spells, taking advantage of the opponent's mana base with cards like Price of Progress. The deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible by overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of damage.

The main concept of this Elves combo deck is to generate a massive amount of mana by tapping Elves for mana and playing cards like Heritage Druid and Priest of Titania. This mana is then used to cast creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Regal Force, while drawing cards with Glimpse of Nature. The deck also includes tools like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to generate extra mana and untap creatures, ensuring a quick and powerful combo finish. Additionally, cards like Summoner's Pact and Green Sun's Zenith provide flexibility and consistency in finding key pieces of the combo.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies using a combination of efficient creatures like Dark Confidant, Knight of the Reliquary, and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruption from cards like Thoughtseize and Vindicate. The deck aims to control the board with powerful removal options such as Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland while also generating card advantage with cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Sylvan Library. The deck also uses a variety of lands to support its game plan, including utility lands like Karakas and Maze of Ith.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures such as Knight of the Reliquary, Geist of Saint Traft, and Stoneforge Mystic fetching powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte. Mother of Runes and Noble Hierarch provide protection and acceleration, while cards like Aven Mindcensor and Scryb Ranger disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck has toolbox options with Green Sun's Zenith and utility lands like Karakas and Maze of Ith. Elspeth, Knight-Errant and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional ways to control the game and close out the match.

The main deck of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro Canadian Threshold archetype focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruptive spells like Daze and Stifle to quickly pressure opponents. The deck also includes powerful removal options like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, along with card advantage through Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage. Additionally, the mana base is optimized with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all colors. This deck aims to apply constant pressure, disrupt opponent's plans, and maintain control of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and leveraging early aggressive creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Stoneforge Mystic, along with support from Noble Hierarch and various equipment. The inclusion of control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares help to protect the creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With access to powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Elspeth, Knight-Errant, the deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with a mix of counterspells, removal, and utility creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Stoneforge Mystic. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own board presence with efficient threats like Geist of Saint Traft and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance its creatures and create advantageous situations. With a strong mana base and a variety of powerful spells, this Control-Stoneblade deck excels at outmaneuvering opponents and dominating the battlefield.

The focus of the deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with discard spells like Hymn to Tourach and Cabal Therapy while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Dark Confidant, Stoneforge Mystic, and Lingering Souls. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares and Zealous Persecution while generating value through card advantage with cards like Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil. The deck also has a strong mana denial component with Wasteland and utilizes equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance its aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this Combo - Show and Tell Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, Kozilek, Butcher of Truth, Progenitus, and Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Lotus Petal. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Trinisphere and Blood Moon to hinder opponents while using cards like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe for card selection and information gathering. The mana base consists of fast lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors alongside fetch lands and dual lands for consistency and color fixing.

The main focus of this Belcher Combo deck in Legacy 1 vs 1 is to quickly generate mana and cast spells to activate Goblin Charbelcher's ability, which allows for a potential game-winning combo. The deck relies on fast mana acceleration cards like Chrome Mox, Lotus Petal, and rituals, along with mana generators like Elvish Spirit Guide and Simian Spirit Guide. Burning Wish is utilized to search for specific cards from the sideboard to help execute the combo effectively. Land Grant and Gitaxian Probe provide additional card advantage and deck thinning.

This deck focuses on using a combination of powerful creatures, disruptive spells, and removal to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Liliana of the Veil, Hymn to Tourach, and Inquisition of Kozilek, it aims to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state. The deck also utilizes creatures like Tarmogoyf and Thrun, the Last Troll, along with removal spells like Maelstrom Pulse and Diabolic Edict, to maintain control of the battlefield. The inclusion of cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Scavenging Ooze provides additional utility and ways to gain advantage in the game.

The main goal of this deck is to overwhelm opponents quickly with a swarm of powerful Goblin creatures. By utilizing cards like Goblin Lackey and Goblin Matron to search for key creatures, such as Goblin Warchief and Goblin Ringleader, the deck can generate a lot of explosive plays. Aether Vial helps accelerate the casting of Goblins, while spells like Gempalm Incinerator and Warren Weirding provide removal options. With a focus on aggression and synergy between Goblin creatures, this deck aims to quickly amass a formidable board presence and overrun the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf while disrupting the opponent with counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. It also utilizes efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. The goal is to apply pressure early on while controlling the game with cards like Brainstorm and Stifle. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy, with fetch lands like Misty Rainforest and dual lands like Tropical Island and Volcanic Island. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main idea of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to control the game using a combination of powerful artifacts and spells. By using cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top cards of their library, the player can quickly shut down their opponent's spells. Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek create a recurring stream of flying creatures to pressure the opponent. Cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares provide additional control and removal options. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and disrupt their game plan while steadily building up advantage.

The main strategy of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with key cards like Bridge from Below and Narcomoeba, then use cards like Cabal Therapy and Dread Return to bring them back to the battlefield for powerful combos. The deck also includes cards like Lion's Eye Diamond for mana acceleration and Flame-Kin Zealot for additional win conditions. The deck is focused on quickly filling the graveyard and overwhelming the opponent with a fast and efficient combo.
